('76', 349, 3, 5, 661155) 447. HORIZONTAL v.
('76', 349, 3, 6, 661174) VERTICAL Prof.
('76', 349, 3, 7, 661189) J. C. Kumarappa has contributed a thought provoking article to the Gram Udyog Patrika for September.
('76', 349, 3, 8, 661290) I take from it the following extracts 2 with slight unimportant alterations.
('76', 349, 4, 9, 661367) According to the conception of the economic organization on which the A. I. V. I. A. is based, the villager is taken as the centre around whom the universe revolves.
('76', 349, 4, 10, 661533) What contributes to his welfare is primary and everything else is secondary.
('76', 349, 4, 11, 661610) Whatever the merits of a plan may be, if it fails to give employment and thereby direct a due share of the wealth produced towards the villager, it will stand condemned.
('76', 349, 4, 12, 661780) The result or end of economic activity is wealth production for consumption by the producers.
('76', 349, 4, 13, 661874) Wealth is usually produced by the intelligent use of the means of production and the application or employment of human talent or power.
('76', 349, 4, 14, 662011) Planning, in the first instance, consists in the rational coordination of these three factors.
('76', 349, 4, 15, 662106) We may express this mathematically thus: W = E + M.
('76', 349, 5, 16, 662158) Here W stands for wealth, E for employment of human talent and M for means in the shape of tools, equipment or capital.
('76', 349, 5, 17, 662278) In this equation, keeping W constant, if M is large, E will have to be small, and vice versa, that is, E and M
('76', 349, 6, 18, 662389) vary inversely.
('76', 349, 6, 19, 662405) Therefore, in planning, our first step will have to be the ascertaining of the availability of E and M. .
('76', 349, 7, 20, 662511) When we look around our country we find E in abundance while M is very scarce and, therefore, if our planning is to be effective, we have to lay our foundation stone on labour and not on capital.
('76', 349, 8, 21, 662707) Most people seem to think that all will be well as long as we produce large quantities of standardized goods.
('76', 349, 8, 22, 662817) They cannot see that the method of large scale production can only be employed as a hand maiden of the cottage and village industries, the former supplying the basic needs of the latter on a service basis.
('76', 349, 9, 23, 663023) Properly conceived, the State should serve the citizen.
('76', 349, 9, 24, 663079) The citizen may work for his profit but not so the State.
('76', 349, 9, 25, 663137) Similarly, the decentralized units may work for profit but not so the centralized units.
('76', 349, 10, 26, 663226) 1 Mahadev Desai adds: “There was no satisfactory reply.
('76', 349, 10, 27, 663282) ‘We should begin listening to God as a whole,’ was their reply .
('76', 349, 10, 28, 663347) .” 2 Only excerpts are reproduced here.
('76', 350, 0, 1, 663387) VOL. 76 : 31 MAY, 1939 15 OCTOBER, 1939 351
('76', 350, 1, 2, 663431) It does not do to plan vertically, i.
('76', 350, 1, 3, 663469) e., emphasizing the functions and thus making them into separate industries, e.
('76', 350, 1, 4, 663549) g., banking, insurance, etc., which is the way of capitalism.
('76', 350, 1, 5, 663611) The other way is to take the industries horizontally and study their processes and apply the functional aid at suitable points.
('76', 350, 1, 6, 663739) The plan of work of the All India Spinners’ Association is a good example of a horizontal system of planning, while a spinning mill is an example of vertical planning.
('76', 350, 1, 7, 663907) There can be no compromise between these two methods..
('76', 350, 1, 8, 663962) ON THE TRAIN TO SIMLA, September 24, 1939 Harijan, 18 11 1939

('76', 353, 0, 1, 667728) 354 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('76', 353, 1, 2, 667770) 453. IS INDIA A MILITARY COUNTRY?
('76', 353, 2, 3, 667804) In the interesting broadcast delivered by the Commander in Chief of the Defence Forces in India on the 5th instant there occurs this passage :
('76', 353, 3, 4, 667947) India is a military country and I am a soldier.
('76', 353, 3, 5, 667995) It will, therefore, perhaps not be amiss if I give you some personal impressions of what the effect of modernization will be on the personnel of the future army in India.
('76', 353, 3, 6, 668166) They are not just guess work but based on what has already been done.
('76', 353, 3, 7, 668236) With new scientific weapons and with modern vehicles, there will inevitably come new ideas and a new outlook.
('76', 353, 3, 8, 668346) Modernization is likely to give increased impetus to the already high rate of education in the Indian Army; and when nearly every solider on discharge returns to his home with a knowledge of motor cars and machinery, there may well be a perceptible effect upon the age old methods of agriculture and ways of living.
('76', 353, 3, 9, 668662) Modernization in the army may therefore have a considerable indirect effect upon the life of India.
('76', 353, 3, 10, 668762) Many of those who hear me will regret the passing of the horse.
('76', 353, 3, 11, 668826) No one regrets it more than myself.
('76', 353, 3, 12, 668862) But as a soldier who knows the fate which awaits the horse in modern warfare, I rejoice for its sake, that one of the greatest and best of friends of man is in future to be spared the horrors of war.
('76', 353, 3, 13, 669062) I must wholly, though respectfully, dissent from the view that India is a military country.
('76', 353, 3, 14, 669154) And I thank God that it is not.
('76', 353, 3, 15, 669186) It may be that the Commander in Chief has a special meaning for the term which I do not know.
('76', 353, 3, 16, 669280) Or is it that his India is composed of only the Defence Forces under his command?
('76', 353, 3, 17, 669362) For me the Defence Forces are of the least importance in the make up of the nation.
('76', 353, 3, 18, 669446) I need not be reminded that life would be in constant peril if the forces were withdrawn.
('76', 353, 3, 19, 669536) The forces notwithstanding, life is not free from peril.
('76', 353, 3, 20, 669593) There are riots, there are murders, there are dacoities, there are raids.
('76', 353, 3, 21, 669667) The Defence Forces avail little in all these perils.
('76', 353, 3, 22, 669720) They generally act after the mischief is done.
('76', 353, 3, 23, 669767) But the gallant Commander in Chief looks at things as a soldier.
('76', 353, 3, 24, 669832) I and, with me the millions are untouched by the military spirit.
('76', 353, 3, 25, 669898) From ages past India has had a military caste in numbers wholly insignificant.
('76', 353, 3, 26, 669977) That caste has had little to do with the millions.
('76', 353, 3, 27, 670028) This, however, is not the occasion for examining its contribution to the making of India.
('76', 353, 3, 28, 670118) All I want to state, with the utmost emphasis at my command, is that the description of India as a military country is wrong.
('76', 353, 3, 29, 670244) Of all the countries in the world India is the least military.
('76', 353, 3, 30, 670307) Though I have failed with the Working Committee in persuading them, at this supreme moment, to declare their undying
('76', 354, 0, 1, 670424) VOL. 76 : 31 MAY, 1939 15 OCTOBER, 1939 355
('76', 354, 1, 2, 670468) faith in non violence as the only sovereign remedy for saving mankind from destruction, I have not lost the hope that the masses will refuse to bow to the Moloch of war but will rely upon their capacity for suffering to save the country’s honour.
('76', 354, 1, 3, 670715) How has the undoubted military valour of Poland served her against the superior forces of Germany and Russia?
('76', 354, 1, 4, 670825) Would Poland unarmed have fared worse if she had met the challenge of these combined forces with the resolution to face death without retaliation?
('76', 354, 1, 5, 670972) Would the invading forces have taken a heavier toll from an infinitely more valorous Poland?
('76', 354, 1, 6, 671065) It is highly probable that their essential nature would have made them desist from a wholesale slaughter of innocents.
('76', 354, 1, 7, 671184) Of all the organizations of the world the Congress is the best fitted to show it the better way, indeed the only way, to the true life.
('76', 354, 1, 8, 671320) Its non violent experiment will have been in vain if, when India wakes up from the present fear, she does not show to the world the way of deliverance from the blood bath.
('76', 354, 1, 9, 671492) The criminal waste of life and wealth that is now going on will not be the last if India does not play her natural part by showing that human dignity is best preserved not by developing the capacity to deal destruction but by refusing to retaliate.
('76', 354, 1, 10, 671741) I have no manner of doubt that if it is possible to train millions in the black art of violence which is the law of the beast, it is more possible to train them in the white art of non violence which is the law of regenerate man.
('76', 354, 1, 11, 671971) Anyway if the Commander in Chief will look beyond the Defence Forces, he will discover that the real India is not military but peace loving.
('76', 354, 1, 12, 672112) Nor do I contemplate without uneasiness the prospect of Indian soldiers, trained after the modern manner, taking the motor spirit to their homes.
('76', 354, 1, 13, 672258) Speed is not the end of life.
('76', 354, 1, 14, 672288) Man sees more and lives more truly by walking to his duty.
('76', 354, 1, 15, 672347) ON THE TRAIN TO SIMLA, September 25, 1939 Harijan, 30 9 1939
('76', 354, 2, 16, 672408) 454. CONUNDRUMS
('76', 354, 3, 17, 672424) Thus asks a well known Congressman :
('76', 354, 4, 18, 672461) 1. What is your personal attitude towards this war consistent with non violence?
('76', 354, 5, 19, 672542) 2. Is it the same as or different from your attitude during the last war?
('76', 355, 0, 1, 672616) 356 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('76', 355, 1, 2, 672658) 3. How could you with your non violence actively associate with and help the Congress whose policy is based on violence in the present crisis?
('76', 355, 2, 3, 672801) 4. What is your concrete plan based on non violence to oppose or prevent this war?
('76', 355, 2, 4, 672884) The questions conclude a long friendly complaint about my seeming inconsistencies or my inscrutability.
('76', 355, 2, 5, 672988) Both are old complaints, perfectly justified from the standpoint of the complainants, wholly un justifed from my own.
('76', 355, 2, 6, 673106) Therefore my complainants and I must agree to differ.
('76', 355, 2, 7, 673160) Only this let me say.
('76', 355, 2, 8, 673182) At the time of writing I never think of what I have said before.
('76', 355, 2, 9, 673247) My aim is not to be consistent with my previous statements on a given question, but to be consistent with truth as it may present itself to me at a given moment.
('76', 355, 2, 10, 673409) The result has been that I have grown from truth to truth; I have saved my memory an un due strain; and what is more, whenever I have been obliged to com pare my writing even of fifty years ago with the latest, I have dis covered no inconsistency between the two.
('76', 355, 2, 11, 673673) But friends who observe inconsistency will do well to take the meaning that my latest writing may yield unless, of course, they prefer the old.
('76', 355, 2, 12, 673817) But before making the choice they should try to see if there is not an underlying and abiding consistency between the two seeming inconsistencies.
('76', 355, 2, 13, 673964) So far as my inscrutability is concerned, friends should take my assurance that there is never any attempt on my part to suppress my thought when it is relevant.
('76', 355, 2, 14, 674126) Sometimes it arises from my desire to be brief.
('76', 355, 2, 15, 674174) And sometimes it must be due to my own ignorance of the subject on which I may be called upon to give an opinion.
('76', 355, 2, 16, 674288) To give a typical instance, a friend 1between whom and me there never is any mental reservation, thus writes 2 in anguish rather than anger : In the not improbable event of India being a theatre of war, is Gandhiji prepared to advise his countrymen to bare their breasts to the enemy’s sword?
('76', 355, 2, 17, 674581) A little while ago I would have pledged my word he would do so, but I am not confident any more.
('76', 355, 2, 18, 674678) I can only assure him that, notwithstanding my recent writings, he can retain his confidence that I would give the same advice as he expects I would have given before, or as I gave to the Czechs 3 or the
('76', 355, 3, 19, 674882) 1 V. S. Srinivasa Sastri 2 In a letter dated September 22, addressed to Mahadev Desai 3 Vide “If I were a Czech”, 6 10 1938.

('76', 356, 1, 2, 675051) Abyssinians 1. My non violence is made of stern stuff.
('76', 356, 1, 3, 675106) It is firmer than the firmest metal known to the scientists.
('76', 356, 1, 4, 675167) Yet, alas, I am painfully conscious of the fact that it has still not attained its native firmness.
('76', 356, 1, 5, 675267) If it had, God would have shown me the way to deal with the many local cases of violence that I helplessly witness daily.
('76', 356, 1, 6, 675389) This is said not in arrogance but in the certain knowledge of the power of perfect non violence.
('76', 356, 1, 7, 675486) I will not have the power of non violence to be underesti mated in order to cover my limitations or weaknesses.
('76', 356, 1, 8, 675598) Now for a few lines in answer to the questions : 1. My personal reaction towards this war is one of greater horror than ever before.
('76', 356, 1, 9, 675731) I was not so disconsolate before as I am today.
('76', 356, 1, 10, 675779) But the greater horror would prevent me today from becoming the self appointed recruiting sergeant that I had become during the last war.
('76', 356, 1, 11, 675917) And yet, strange as it may appear, my symapthies are wholly with the Allies.
('76', 356, 1, 12, 675994) Willy nilly this war is resolving itself into one between such democracy as the West has evolved and totalitarianism as it is typified in Herr Hitler.
('76', 356, 1, 13, 676145) Though the part that Russia is playing is painful, let us hope that the unnatural combination will result in a happy though unintended fusion whose shape no one can foretell.
('76', 356, 1, 14, 676320) Unless the Allies suffer demoralization, of which there is not the slightest indication, this war may be used to end all wars, at any rate of the virulent type that we see today.
('76', 356, 1, 15, 676499) I have the hope that India, distraught though it is with internal dissensions, will play an effective part in ensuring the desired end and the spread of cleaner democracy than hitherto.
('76', 356, 1, 16, 676685) This will undoubtedly depend upon how the Working Committee will ultimately act in the real tragedy that is being played on the world stage.
('76', 356, 1, 17, 676826) We are both actors in and spectators of the drama.
('76', 356, 1, 18, 676877) My line is cast.
('76', 356, 1, 19, 676894) Whether I act as a humble guide of the Working Committee or, if I may use the same expression, without offence, of the Government, my guidance will be for the deliberate purpose of taking either or both along the path of non violence, be the step ever so imperceptible.
('76', 356, 1, 20, 677164) It is plain that I cannot force the pace either way.
('76', 356, 1, 21, 677217) I can only use such power as God may endow my head or heart with for the moment.
('76', 356, 1, 22, 677298) 2. I think I have covered the second question in answering the first.
('76', 356, 1, 23, 677368) 3. There are degrees of violence as of non violence.

('76', 357, 1, 2, 677593) Working Committee has not wilfully departed from the policy of non violence.
('76', 357, 1, 3, 677670) It could not honestly accept the real implications of non violence.
('76', 357, 1, 4, 677738) I felt that the vast mass of Congressmen had never clearly understood that in the event of danger from without they were to defend the country by non violent means.
('76', 357, 1, 5, 677903) All that they had learnt truly was that they could put up a successful fight, on the whole non violent, against the British Government.
('76', 357, 1, 6, 678039) Congressmen have had no training in the use of non violence in other fields.

('76', 357, 1, 11, 678637) 4. I have no ready made concrete plan.

('76', 357, 1, 16, 678933) More will be revealed to me from day to day, as all my plans always have been.
('76', 357, 1, 17, 679012) The famous non co operation resolution 1 came to me within less than 24 hours of the meeting of the A.I.C.C. at which it was moved in Calcutta in 1920; and so did practi cally the Dandi March.

('76', 357, 1, 19, 679471) I had gone to the meeting with no preconceived resolution.
('76', 357, 1, 20, 679530) It was born at the meeting.
('76', 357, 1, 21, 679558) The creation is still expanding.
('76', 357, 1, 22, 679591) But assuming that God had endowed me with full powers (which He never does), I would at once ask the English to lay down arms, free all their vassals, take pride in being called “Little Englanders” and defy all the totalitarians of the world to do their worst.
('76', 357, 1, 23, 679852) Englishmen will then die unresistingly and go down to history as heroes of non violence.
('76', 357, 1, 24, 679941) I would further invite Indians to co operate with Englishmen in this

('76', 358, 3, 9, 680573) 455. THE OLD REVOLUTIONARY Readers of Harijan know that after twenty five years, part of which was spent in jail and sixteen in hiding as an absconder, Sardar Prithvi Singh finds himself a free man.
('76', 358, 3, 10, 680772) He cannot call a life of freedom those sixteen years of dodging the C. I. D., assuming new names and new dresses as circumstances demanded.
('76', 358, 3, 11, 680912) The reader will recall that Prithvi Singh made up his mind to discover himself to me last year when I was convalescing in Juhu, to confess his past sins and regulate his future under my guidance.
('76', 358, 3, 12, 681108) I advised him to surrender himself to the police and purge his past by becoming a prisoner amenable to prison discipline by choice.
('76', 358, 3, 13, 681240) I had told him that though I would try to secure his discharge, he must not bank upon my success but should be content, if necessary, to pass the rest of his life in prison.
('76', 358, 3, 14, 681414) Quite cheerfully and light heartedly he showed his prepared ness to face life imprisonment.
('76', 358, 3, 15, 681506) With sincere conviction he accepted the truth that voluntary imprisonment might be as good service of the country as life outside.
('76', 358, 3, 16, 681637) I am glad to be able to say that he was true to his word.
('76', 358, 3, 17, 681695) The readers know from Mahadev Desai’s description of him after his visit to the Sardar in Rawalpindi prison that he was a cent percent model prisoner.
('76', 358, 3, 18, 681846) He endeared himself to his jailors who never found misplaced the trust that they had reposed in him.
('76', 358, 3, 19, 681947) He learnt wool spinning and cotton spinning and worked at the first so assiduously that even his powerfully built body had to take relaxation from strenuous labour.
('76', 358, 3, 20, 682112) First Pyarelal’s and then Mahadev Desai’s enthusiastic testimony in favour of Sardar Prithvi Singh’s exemplary conduct in the jail decided me.
('76', 358, 3, 21, 682255) Mahadev Desai felt confident that he could plead the cause successfully before Sir Sikandar Hyat Khan.
('76', 358, 3, 22, 682358) I let him go.
('76', 358, 3, 23, 682372) Sir Sikander made a generous response.
('76', 358, 3, 24, 682411) He was impressed with the truth of Mahadev’s description, fortified as it was by the uniformly good reports from the officials in charge of Sardar Prithvi Singh.
('76', 358, 3, 25, 682573) Mahadev knocked also at the Viceregal gates.
('76', 358, 3, 26, 682618) The result was
('76', 359, 0, 1, 682633) 360 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('76', 359, 1, 2, 682675) that Sardar Prithvi Singh was delivered to me by the authorities on the 22nd instant.
('76', 359, 1, 3, 682761) I greeted him with the remark that he had transferred himself from one jail to another and harder.
('76', 359, 1, 4, 682860) He smiled a hearty assent.
('76', 359, 1, 5, 682887) He knows that he is on his trial.
('76', 359, 1, 6, 682921) He has been a staunch believer in violence as the only way to the deliverance of his country.
('76', 359, 1, 7, 683015) He has to his credit examples of daring which may be equalled by some but surpassed by no revolutionary.
('76', 359, 1, 8, 683120) His life is rich in romance.
('76', 359, 1, 9, 683149) But by patient introspection he discovered that fundamentally his was a life of falsity, and that true deliverance could never come out of falsity.
('76', 359, 1, 10, 683297) In spite of the glamour that surrounded his life of hiding and the adoration of his companions who marvelled at his exploits, he had wearied of the false life and the hiding.
('76', 359, 1, 11, 683472) The gymnastic lessons he gave to hundreds of young men had given him no satisfaction.
('76', 359, 1, 12, 683558) Fortunately he had companions like Nanabhai of Dakshinamurti.
('76', 359, 1, 13, 683620) They guided his footsteps towards me.

('76', 359, 1, 17, 683876) If now he has assimilated ahimsa, his non violence should be infinitely richer in romance than his past violence.
('76', 359, 1, 18, 683990) He should by God’s grace be a modern exemplar of the proverb: “The greater the sinner the greater the saint.” He has shown me authenticated leaves from his diary in which he describes his first night as a voluntary prisoner as death.
('76', 359, 1, 19, 684224) I pick up the following striking passage from it:
('76', 359, 2, 20, 684274) Today is the day of my surrender when under divine guidance I surrender everything I can call my own.
('76', 359, 2, 21, 684376) For a period of 25 years I had faced all perils and worked hard to acquire the light which could guide me in the field of service.
('76', 359, 2, 22, 684507) As a revolutionary of good experience I used to look upon my achievements with pride.
('76', 359, 2, 23, 684593) 19th May is an eventful day in my life—the day when I realized that by treading the trodden path I would not enrich my nation nor make any contribution to the uplift of humanity.
('76', 359, 2, 24, 684772) This 19th May is the day of the greatest adventure of my life.
('76', 359, 2, 25, 684835) The present life has no charm, no meaning for me.
('76', 359, 2, 26, 684885) I must have a new life.

('76', 359, 2, 31, 685073) There was not much room for reason.
('76', 359, 2, 32, 685109) It was faith which led me to make my choice.
('76', 359, 2, 33, 685154) May the freedom the Sardar now enjoys prove that his notes were no creation of a heated imagination but were an expression of a yearning soul.

('76', 365, 0, 1, 690848) 366 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('76', 365, 1, 2, 690890) 467. HINDU MUSLIM UNITY
('76', 365, 2, 3, 690914) During my last journey to Simla my attention was drawn to the bitterness with which, it was alleged, the Muslim League and its doings were being criticized in some Congress organs.
('76', 365, 2, 4, 691095) I have not seen any such criticism for the simple reason that I do not see the papers except for a few moments daily.
('76', 365, 2, 5, 691213) But if there is any ground for such complaint, it should certainly be removed.
('76', 365, 2, 6, 691292) The Muslim League is a great organization.
('76', 365, 2, 7, 691335) Its President was at one time an ardent Con gressman.
('76', 365, 2, 8, 691389) He was the rising hope of the Congress.
('76', 365, 2, 9, 691429) His battles with Lord Willingdon cannot be forgotten.
('76', 365, 2, 10, 691483) The Jinnah Hall of the Bombay Congress is a standing monument of the President’s labours for the Congress and a mark of Congressmen’s generous appreciation of his services.
('76', 365, 2, 11, 691656) The League contains many members who were whole heartedly with the Congress during the memorable Khilafat days.
('76', 365, 2, 12, 691768) I refuse to think that these erstwhile comrades can be as bitter in their hearts towards their fellow workers of yesterday as their speeches and writings of today will show.
('76', 365, 2, 13, 691942) It is, therefore, wrong of Congressmen and Congress organs if they are bitter against the League or its individual members.
('76', 365, 2, 14, 692066) The Congress policy of non violence should put an easy restraint upon the speech, writings and actions of Congress men in their dealings with the League and its members.
('76', 365, 2, 15, 692236) They must resolutely believe and hope that sooner or later, and sooner rather than later, there is to be communal unity, not superficial but real and lasting.
('76', 365, 2, 16, 692395) Zahid, the late Big Brother’s 1 son, who met me in Simla said, “We must not quarrel.
('76', 365, 2, 17, 692480) Blood is thicker than water.
('76', 365, 2, 18, 692509) We are of the same blood.
('76', 365, 2, 19, 692535) You must work for unity.” Other Muslim friends who met me during the journey said: “You must bring about unity.
('76', 365, 2, 20, 692647) You alone can do it.
('76', 365, 2, 21, 692668) Heaven help us if unity is not achieved in your lifetime.” I have a similar message from a great Muslim.
('76', 365, 2, 22, 692773) All this may flatter my vanity.
('76', 365, 2, 23, 692805) But I know that it does humble me.
('76', 365, 2, 24, 692840) I wish God had given me the power to realize the hope genuinely expressed by so many Muslim friends.
('76', 365, 2, 25, 692941) I assure them that not a day passes but I think of and pray for the unity.
('76', 365, 2, 26, 693016) It is neither for want of will nor effort that I have to be a helpless witness of so much bitterness and quarrelling between the two.
('76', 365, 2, 27, 693150) I have not lost hope that I shall live to see real unity established between not only Hindus and Muslims but
('76', 365, 3, 28, 693259) 1 Shaukat Ali, who died on November 27, 1938
('76', 366, 0, 1, 693304) VOL. 76 : 31 MAY, 1939 15 OCTOBER, 1939 367
('76', 366, 1, 2, 693348) all the communities that make India a nation.
('76', 366, 1, 3, 693394) If I knew the way to achieve it today, I know that I have the will and the strength to take it, however difficult or thorny it may be.
('76', 366, 1, 4, 693529) I know too that the shortest and the surest way lies through non violence.
('76', 366, 1, 5, 693604) Some Muslim friends tell me that Muslims will never subscribe to unadulterated non violence.
('76', 366, 1, 6, 693697) With them, they say, violence is as lawful and necessary as non violence.
('76', 366, 1, 7, 693771) The use of either depends upon circumstances.
('76', 366, 1, 8, 693817) It does not need Koranic authority to justify the lawfulness of both.
('76', 366, 1, 9, 693887) That is the well known path the world has traversed through the ages.
('76', 366, 1, 10, 693957) There is no such thing as unadulterated violence in the world.
('76', 366, 1, 11, 694020) But I have heard it from many Muslim friends that the Koran teaches the use of non violence.
('76', 366, 1, 12, 694113) It regards forbearance as superior to vengeance.
('76', 366, 1, 13, 694162) The very word Islam means peace, which is non violence.
('76', 366, 1, 14, 694218) Badshah Kha 1 a staunch Muslim who never misses his namaz and Ramzan, has accepted out and out non violence as his creed.
('76', 366, 1, 15, 694340) It would be no answer to say that he does not live up to his creed, even as I know to my shame that I do not.
('76', 366, 1, 16, 694450) If there is difference in our actions, the difference is not one of kind, it is of degree.
('76', 366, 1, 17, 694541) But argument about non violence in the holy Koran is an interpolation, not necessary for my thesis.
('76', 366, 1, 18, 694641) I hold that for the full play of non violence only one party need believe in it.
('76', 366, 1, 19, 694722) Indeed if both believe in it and live up to it, there is no appreciation or demonstration of it.
('76', 366, 1, 20, 694819) To live at peace with one another is the most natural thing to do.
('76', 366, 1, 21, 694886) But neither party gains the merit that the exercise of non violence carries with it.
('76', 366, 1, 22, 694971) Unfortunately, at the present moment, those Hindus who do not know the use of violence, though they have it in their hearts, are sorry for their incapacity and would fain learn the trick—I won’t call it the art—of violence, so as to be able to match what they describe as Muslim violence.
('76', 366, 1, 23, 695260) And if peace is to be brought about by both parties being equally matched in the use of violence both offensive and defensive, I know that peace will not come in my lifetime and, if it came, I should not care to be witness of it.
('76', 366, 1, 24, 695490) It will be an armed peace to be broken at any moment.
('76', 366, 1, 25, 695544) Such has been the peace in Europe.
('76', 366, 1, 26, 695579) Is not the present war enough to make one sick of such peace?
('76', 366, 1, 27, 695641) Muslim friends who hope much from me will perhaps now recognize my agony for the unattainment of peace in spite of the travail that I have gone through and am still going through.
('76', 366, 2, 28, 695821) 1 Khan Abdul Ghaffar Khan
('76', 367, 0, 1, 695847) 368 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('76', 367, 1, 2, 695889) should also see that my principal work lies through teaching at least the Hindus to learn the art of non violence unless I can bring the Muslims to the position the Ali Brothers and their associates took up during the Khilafat days.
('76', 367, 1, 3, 696122) They used to say: “Even if our Hindu brethren cut us to pieces, yet will we love them.
('76', 367, 1, 4, 696209) They are our kith and kin.” The late Maulana Abdul Bari used to say: “Muslims of India will never forget the ungrudging and unconditional support that Hindus have given to us at this critical period of our history.” I am sure that both Hindus and Muslims of those days are the same today that they were then.
('76', 367, 1, 5, 696518) But times have changed and with them have changed our manners.
('76', 367, 1, 6, 696581) I have no shadow of a doubt that our hearts will meet some day.
('76', 367, 1, 7, 696645) What seems impossible today for us God will make possible tomorrow.
('76', 367, 1, 8, 696713) For that day I work, live and pray.
('76', 367, 2, 9, 696749) ON THE TRAIN TO WARDHA, September 28, 1939 Harijan, 7 10 1939
('76', 367, 3, 10, 696811) 468. NOTES
('76', 367, 4, 11, 696822) A STRIKING THOUGHT A Pathan friend who met me during the journey, talking about violent deeds, said: “You know the Government is strong enough to put down any violence however organized it may be in our country, but your non violence is uncanny.
('76', 367, 4, 12, 697068) You have given our country a wonderful weapon.
('76', 367, 4, 13, 697115) No Government in the world can put down non violence.” I complimented my visitor on the striking thought he gave me.
('76', 367, 4, 14, 697232) In one sentence he presented the matchless beauty of non violence.
('76', 367, 4, 15, 697299) If only India can understand the full implications of the remark so naturally, so effortlessly made by the Pathan friend, she will become unconquerable in the face of any combination of invaders.
('76', 367, 4, 16, 697495) Ten to one there will be no raid on a people trained in non violence.
('76', 367, 4, 17, 697565) Indeed the weakest State can render itself immune from attack if it learns the art of non violence.
('76', 367, 4, 18, 697665) But a small State, no matter how powerfully armed it is, cannot exist in the midst of a powerful combination of well armed States.
('76', 367, 4, 19, 697796) It has to be absorbed by or be under the protection of one of the members of such a combination.
('76', 367, 4, 20, 697893) Well does Badshah Khan say, as reported by Pyarelal during my last tour in his province :
('76', 367, 5, 21, 697983) We would have fared ill if we had not learnt the lesson of non violence.
('76', 367, 5, 22, 698056) We have taken it up quite selfishly.
('76', 367, 5, 23, 698093) We are born fighters and we keep up the
('76', 368, 0, 1, 698133) VOL. 76 : 31 MAY, 1939 15 OCTOBER, 1939 369
('76', 368, 1, 2, 698177) tradition by fighting amongst ourselves.
('76', 368, 1, 3, 698218) Once a murder takes place in a family or a clan it becomes a point of honour to avenge it.
('76', 368, 1, 4, 698309) There is no such thing generally as forgiveness among us.
('76', 368, 1, 5, 698367) And so there is avenging and re avenging and re re avenging.
('76', 368, 1, 6, 698428) And thus the vicious circle never ends.
('76', 368, 1, 7, 698468) This non violence has come to us as a positive deliverence.
('76', 368, 1, 8, 698528) What is true of the Frontier Provice is true of all of us.
('76', 368, 1, 9, 698587) Without knowing it we move in the vicious circle of violence.
('76', 368, 1, 10, 698649) A little reflection and corresponding practice should enable us to get out of the circle.
('76', 368, 1, 11, 698739) NARSINGHGARH The reader knows that at the invitation of the Dewan of Nar singhgarh and with the consent of the Secretary of the Central India States Conference I had sent Rajkumari Amrit Kaur to inquire into certain allegations made against the State.
('76', 368, 1, 12, 698991) The Rajkumari was given every facility by the State to make what inquiry she liked.
('76', 368, 1, 13, 699075) Shri Kanhaiyalal Vaidya was present during the enquiry.
('76', 368, 1, 14, 699131) The Rajkumari’s way was made easy by the State giving her every facility.
('76', 368, 1, 15, 699205) The imme diate cause of complaint was soon settled to the satisfaction of all con cerned.
('76', 368, 1, 16, 699295) The Maharaja has given cautious assurances of civil liberty.
('76', 368, 1, 17, 699356) The people of these States have hitherto been strangers to civil liberty and all it means.
('76', 368, 1, 18, 699447) I hope the Maharaja and his advisers will remember that civil liberty means the fullest liberty, consistent with non violence, to speak, write and do what the people like, even though it may mean strong criticism of the acts of the State.
('76', 368, 1, 19, 699686) He has, however given full permission to Shri Vaidya to do khadi, Harijan and other constructive work.
('76', 368, 1, 20, 699789) He has also requested the Rajkumari to send Shri Shankerlal Banker or a representative of the A.I.S.A. to the State in order to explore the possibilities of khadi work in the State which grows plenty of cotton.
('76', 368, 1, 21, 700000) He has also shown interest in other village industries and basic education.
('76', 368, 1, 22, 700076) I hope that the beginning so well made will continue uninterrupted, and that the people of Narsinghgarh will show political, economic, social and moral progress on an ever increasing scale.
('76', 368, 1, 23, 700266) From the correspondence I had with the Dewan, I have reason to hope for the best.
('76', 368, 1, 24, 700348) Much will depend upon the sym pathy of the Maharaja and his advisers towards all round progress and the restrained manner in which the workers use the liberty given by the State.
('76', 368, 1, 25, 700527) I must congratulate the Maharaja and the Dewan on having shown wisdom and courage in calling in the Congress aid (for my aid is virtually Congress aid) for settling their domestic difficulty.
('76', 368, 1, 26, 700719) This is perhaps the second instance of its kind.
('76', 368, 1, 27, 700768) ON THE TRAIN TO WARDHA, September 28, 1939 Harijan, 7 10 1939

('76', 369, 2, 3, 700898) September 28, 1939 I am an optimist, I have pinned my faith in hope.

('76', 369, 4, 6, 701074) 470. STATEMENT TO THE PRESS 2
('76', 369, 5, 7, 701104) SEGAON, September 28, 1939 An advance copy of Reuter’s summary of the Lords’ debate on Indian affairs has been shown to me.
('76', 369, 5, 8, 701228) Perhaps silence on my part at this juncture would be a distinct disservice both to India and England.
('76', 369, 5, 9, 701330) I was unprepared for the old familiar flavour in the debate in the shape of drawing comparisons unflattering to the Congress.
('76', 369, 5, 10, 701456) I maintain that the Congress is an all inclusive body.
('76', 369, 5, 11, 701511) Without offence to anybody it can be said of it that it is the one body that has represented for over half a century, without a rival, the vast masses of India irrespective of class or creed.
('76', 369, 5, 12, 701703) It has not a single interest opposed to that of the Mussalmans or that of the people of the States.
('76', 369, 5, 13, 701803) Recent years have shown unmistakably that the Congress represents beyond doubt the interests of the people of the States.
('76', 369, 5, 14, 701925) It is that organization which has asked 3 for a clear definition of the British intentions.
('76', 369, 5, 15, 702017) If the British are fighting for the freedom of all, then their representatives have to state in the clearest possible terms that the freedom of India is necessarily included in the war aim.
('76', 369, 5, 16, 702207) The content of such freedom can only be decided by Indians and them alone.
('76', 369, 5, 17, 702282) Surely it is wrong for Lord Zetland to complain as he does, though in gentle terms, that the Congress should, at this juncture when Britain is engaged in a life and death struggle, ask for a clear declaration of British intentions.
('76', 369, 5, 18, 702514) I suggest that the Congress has done nothing strange or less than
('76', 369, 6, 19, 702580) 1 The source reported that “when Gandhiji passed through Nagpur en route to Wardha”, he was asked by some people “about his interview with H.E. the Viceroy”.
('76', 369, 6, 20, 702738) 2 This appeared under the title “Open a New Chapter”.
('76', 369, 6, 21, 702792) The statement was also published by the The Bombay Chronicle and The Hindu on September 29. 3 Vide Appendices “Congress Working Committee Resolution”, after 18 7 1939; “Working Committee’s Manifesto”, 14 9 1939; and “A.I.C.C. Resolution”, 14 10 1939.
('76', 370, 0, 1, 703043) VOL. 76 : 31 MAY, 1939 15 OCTOBER, 1939 371
('76', 370, 1, 2, 703087) honourable in asking for such a declaration.
('76', 370, 1, 3, 703132) Only a free India’s help is of value.
('76', 370, 1, 4, 703170) And the Congress has every right to know that it can go to the people and tell them that at the end of the war India’s status as an independent country is as much assured as that of Great Britain.
('76', 370, 1, 5, 703367) As a friend of the British I, therefore, appeal to English statesmen that they will forget the old language of imperialists and open a new chapter for all those who have been held under imperial bondage.
('76', 370, 2, 6, 703571) Harijan, 7 10 1939

('76', 371, 8, 15, 705089) SEGAON, WARDHA, September 29, 1939
('76', 371, 9, 16, 705124) MANUDI, SURENDRA, Ba gave me the news about Surendra’s illness.
('76', 371, 9, 17, 705188) How is he now?
('76', 371, 9, 18, 705203) I could not reply to your letter.

('76', 374, 5, 9, 708831) 479. NOTES
('76', 374, 6, 10, 708842) THANKS Sir Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan has made much of my seventy first birthday.
('76', 374, 6, 11, 708922) He has sent me his book 4 of praises from friends, known and unknown to me.
('76', 374, 6, 12, 708998) With it he has been good enough to send also a covering letter of further appreciation.
('76', 374, 6, 13, 709086) I do not know when I shall have the time to go through all the tributes collected in the volume.
('76', 374, 6, 14, 709183) I can only pray that God may give me the capacity to live up to the contributors’ picture of me whatever it may be.
('76', 374, 6, 15, 709299) To Sir Sarvepalli and all those who have sent me their blessings and greeti ngs, I return my thanks hereby.
('76', 374, 6, 16, 709407) It is impossible for me to send per sonal acknowledgements.
('76', 374, 6, 17, 709467) One warning I should like to issue to my admirers.
('76', 374, 6, 18, 709518) Some would like to erect my statues in public places, some others would have portraits, yet others would proclaim my birthday as a public holiday.
('76', 374, 6, 19, 709665) C. Rajagopalachari knows me well and so he has wisely vetoed the proposal to declare my birthday a public holiday.
('76', 374, 6, 20, 709780) These are days of dissensions and discord.
('76', 374, 6, 21, 709823) I should feel deeply humiliated if my name became in any way an occasion for accentuating them.
('76', 374, 6, 22, 709919) Avoidance of such opportunity is a real service to the country and me.
('76', 374, 6, 23, 709990) Statues, photographs and the like have no place today.
('76', 374, 6, 24, 710045) The only praise I would like and treasure is promotion of the activities to which my life is dedicated.
('76', 374, 6, 25, 710149) He or she who does a single act to produce communal harmony or to destroy the demon of untouchability or to advance the cause of the villages, brings me real joy and peace.

('76', 376, 1, 2, 712813) 480. LACK OF SENSE OF HUMOUR
('76', 376, 2, 3, 712842) I cannot resist publishing the following very frank and well meaning letter addressed to the Editor :
('76', 376, 3, 4, 712944) I earnestly request you to be kind enough to give me a few minutes to clear some of my doubts.
('76', 376, 3, 5, 713039) I write this letter not as a critic.
('76', 376, 3, 6, 713076) I am an ardent seeker after truth and one of the many ‘Ekalavyas’ of Bapuji.
('76', 376, 4, 7, 713153) I am rather very much pained to read the following in this week’s Harijan in the course of a note under the caption “Why Only Prohibition” 1
('76', 376, 5, 8, 713294) written by Bapuji: “Therefore if I treated these evils as I have treated the drink evil and if I begin to organize picketing in respect of them, I should lose my caste, lose my mahatmaship and even lose my head which of course has very little value at this time of my life.
('76', 376, 5, 9, 713568) But as I do not wish to suffer the triple loss, I must allow my correspondent and others like him to think that I am shirking an obvious duty.”
('76', 376, 6, 10, 713712) I was not prepared for the above note, especially the portion quoted by me, along with his previous writings and my reading of his life.
('76', 376, 6, 11, 713849) For, I was, and am still, of the opinion that Bapuji stands for ‘Truth’ and he would be ready to lose any donation whatever it may be, his mahatmaship, his caste and, if necessary, even his head for the sake of Truth, i.
('76', 376, 6, 12, 714070) e., God.
('76', 376, 7, 13, 714079) Now let us examine some of his writings.
('76', 376, 7, 14, 714120) In his Autobiography (Part
('76', 376, 8, 15, 714147) V, Ch. X) he says when he accepted Dudabhai, an untouchable, and his family, “All monetary help, however, was stopped.
('76', 376, 8, 16, 714266) With the stopping of monetary help came rumours of proposed social boycott.
('76', 376, 8, 17, 714342) We were prepared for all this.” 2
('76', 376, 9, 18, 714376) This clearly indicates that he was not ready to accept donations or maintain his caste at the cost of his principle, i.
('76', 376, 9, 19, 714496) e., Truth.
('76', 376, 10, 20, 714507) In an article “Truth v.
('76', 376, 10, 21, 714531) Brahmacharya” (Young India, February 25, 1926) he
('76', 376, 11, 22, 714581) says: “My mahatmaship is worthless.
('76', 376, 11, 23, 714617) It is due to my outward activities, due to my politics, which is the least part of me and is therefore evanescent.
('76', 376, 11, 24, 714732) What is of abiding worth is my insistence on truth, non violence and brahmacharya.” 3 In yet another article he has tried to show the “Handicap of Mahatmaship” 4 (Young India, Nov.
('76', 376, 11, 25, 714913) 8, 1928).
('76', 376, 12, 26, 714923) What else is necessary to show that he cares naught for his mahatmaship?
('76', 376, 13, 27, 714996) 1 Vide “Notes”, 21 8 1939. 2 Vide “An Autobiography PartV, On The Anvil”, Chapter X,.
('76', 376, 13, 28, 715082) 3 Vide “Truth v.
('76', 376, 13, 29, 715099) Brahmacharya”, 25 2 1926. 4 Vide “Handicap of Mahatmaship”, 8 11 1928.
('76', 377, 0, 1, 715170) 378 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('76', 377, 1, 2, 715212) Moreover he says in the course of a conversation reported in Harijan,
('76', 377, 2, 3, 715282) August 29, 1936: “I am here to serve no one else but myself, to find my own realization.
('76', 377, 2, 4, 715371) Man’s ultimate aim is the realization of God, and all his activities, social, political religious have to be guided by the ultimate aim of the vision of God.” 1 In another place (Young India, October 11, 1928) he says:
('76', 377, 3, 5, 715590) “I know too that I shall never know God if I do not wrestle with and against evil even at the cost of life itself.” 2
('76', 377, 4, 6, 715708) I hope that these are enough to prove that he stands for Truth and not for anything else.
('76', 377, 4, 7, 715798) It may be perhaps that he does not recognize these evils, viz., gambling, race, cinema, etc., as such or so dangerous as the evil of drink or untouchability to lead an agitation against them, “to wrestle with and against them at the cost of life itself”.
('76', 377, 5, 8, 716053) Anyhow I am sure that there will be a number of readers of Harijan like
('76', 377, 6, 9, 716125) me who will not be prepared to read a statement like this from the pen of Bapuji.
('76', 377, 6, 10, 716207) Now I ask you what does he stand for?
('76', 377, 6, 11, 716245) For donations, caste, mahatmaship, etc., at the cost of Truth, or for Truth at the cost of all these?
('76', 377, 6, 12, 716347) Will you kindly refer this to Bapuji and correct the misunderstanding created by the above note ?
('76', 377, 6, 13, 716445) If the writer, who is manifestly a close student of my writings and is himself a schoolmaster, took seriously my note in Harijan about gambling, etc., there must be quite a number of other readers who too had the same doubts as the correspondent.
('76', 377, 6, 14, 716692) The corres pondent has quoted enough from my writings to enable him to know that the note was written in a humorous vein.
('76', 377, 6, 15, 716814) But unfortunately many of us have no sense of humour.
('76', 377, 6, 16, 716868) Therefore, in order to secure appreciation, humour evidently has to be boldly labelled as such.
('76', 377, 6, 17, 716964) The reader should have known that by writing the note I had expressed my disapproval of cinemas, races, share market, gambling and the like.
('76', 377, 6, 18, 717105) I had tried to show also that these vices were fashionable and therefore were not capable of being dealt with like prohibition.
('76', 377, 6, 19, 717233) I claim to be a practical reformer.
('76', 377, 6, 20, 717269) I know almost instinctively what vices are ripe for being publicly dealt with.
('76', 377, 6, 21, 717348) Of course it may be that I lack the courage to tackle the others and cover my cowardice by pleading untimeliness.
('76', 377, 6, 22, 717462) No man can get over his limitations beyond a point.
('76', 377, 6, 23, 717514) But my correspondent has shown from my writings that at the time I had the courage to the face unpopularity and loss of every thing.
('76', 377, 6, 24, 717647) Let those who might have been disturbed by my innocent note
('76', 377, 7, 25, 717707) 1 Vide “A Discussion with Maurice Frydman”, on or before 25 8 1936. 2 Vide “God Is”11 10 1928.
('76', 378, 0, 1, 717802) VOL. 76 : 31 MAY, 1939 15 OCTOBER, 1939 379
('76', 378, 1, 2, 717846) reassure themselves that I retain the same spirit as before to face difficulties and trials in the prosecution of public causes.
('76', 378, 1, 3, 717975) Time has not weakened it in any way; it has, if possible, strengthened it.
('76', 378, 1, 4, 718050) But I am humble enough to restrain my ambition and to feel thankful to God for what capacity He has vouchsafed to me for the service of the country and humanity.

('76', 378, 3, 6, 718271) 481. LETTER TO GOBIND DAS CONSUL
('76', 378, 4, 7, 718304) ON THE TRAIN, October 1, 1939
('76', 378, 5, 8, 718334) DEAR FRIEND, I have just glanced through your production for five minutes.

('76', 378, 9, 15, 718675) 482. UNFORTUNATE PEOPLE OF TRAVANCORE
('76', 378, 10, 16, 718713) An evil fate seems to dog the career of the people of Travancore in so far as they are represented by the State Congress.
('76', 378, 10, 17, 718835) The Congress is composed of some of its bravest and most self sacrificing men.
('76', 378, 10, 18, 718914) But unfortunately there never have been happy relations between them and the able Dewan of the State.
('76', 378, 10, 19, 719016) The charges brought against him by the Congress in the preliminary stages of the movement for res ponsible government somehow or other acerbated the relations.
('76', 378, 10, 20, 719176) The framers of the charges, as I happen to know from personal con versations with them, honestly believed in them.
('76', 378, 10, 21, 719291) But when I reasoned with them that they were bound to withdraw them if their cause was the attainment of responsible government, and not the removal of the Dewan—a case in which India could not be interested—they saw the wisdom of my advice and promptly acted upon it.
('76', 378, 10, 22, 719560) This cleared the
('76', 379, 0, 1, 719577) 380 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('76', 379, 1, 2, 719619) ground for them and made their case unassailable.
('76', 379, 1, 3, 719669) But I feel that the estrangement created by the charges between the Dewan and the leaders has persisted.
('76', 379, 1, 4, 719774) I wish it has been otherwise.
('76', 379, 1, 5, 719804) Though civil disobedience has been discontinued and personal talks between the Dewan and the leaders have taken place, cordiality between them has been lacking.
('76', 379, 1, 6, 719965) On the contrary there has been a ring of distrust about their talks.
('76', 379, 1, 7, 720034) The Dewan has kept himself at a safe distance from the leaders.
('76', 379, 1, 8, 720098) Negotiations after a struggle are generally preceded by discharge of prisoners and withdrawal of prosecutions and removal of other disabilities.
('76', 379, 1, 9, 720243) In Travancore these things have not happened.
('76', 379, 1, 10, 720289) Can cellations of lawyers’ sanads and suspension of elected members of the Assembly remain.
('76', 379, 1, 11, 720381) In fact there is not much sign of an advance by the State towards the leaders.
('76', 379, 1, 12, 720460) And now comes like a bombshell suspension of negotiations for political reform.
('76', 379, 1, 13, 720540) These are the words of the Travancore communique 1 :
('76', 379, 2, 14, 720593) For reasons which must be obvious and which have, for instance, influenced the Government of India in their decision 2 regarding the Federal negotiations, no conversations can possibly take place regarding any constitutional reforms until normal conditions are restored and the position is stabilized.
('76', 379, 3, 15, 720895) This is followed by the following minatory warning :
('76', 379, 4, 16, 720948) With reference to the statement to the Press issued by the President of the Travancore State Congress and his letter to the Dewan, Government wish to point out while they do not intend to curb or put a check upon ordinary activities of political organizations and while their ideas are unaltered as to consultations with political organizations and leaders as soon as conditions permit, they cannot possibly allow an organized scheme of agitation to be conducted at this juncture, in view of the present situation and especially the likelihood of increased unemployment owing to war conditions and the public excitement that may be caused by the situation regarding foodstuffs and other commodities.
('76', 379, 4, 17, 721648) Such a scheme of agitation is bound to give rise to serious repercussions and results, and the Government, who have a duty to protect the law abiding inhabitants of the State, cannot possibly take the risks involved thereby nor can they at present devote any attention to questions relating to constitutional demands.
('76', 379, 4, 18, 721966) Government desire to warn the Travancore State
('76', 379, 5, 19, 722013) 1 Dated September 23, 1939 2 Addressing a joint session of both the Houses of the Central Legislature on September 11, the Viceroy had announced that the work in connection with the preparations for Federation were held in suspense in view of the war.
('76', 380, 0, 1, 722265) VOL. 76 : 31 MAY, 1939 15 OCTOBER, 1939 381
('76', 380, 1, 2, 722309) Congress and other organizations with similar programme that they will be forced to take steps both under the ordinary law and under the Defence of Travancore Proclamation and Rules for maintaining normal conditions and a peaceful atmosphere in the State.
('76', 380, 1, 3, 722565) The reason for suspension of contemplated reform is wholly unconvincing.
('76', 380, 1, 4, 722638) So far as I know in no State has such suspension been thought necessary.
('76', 380, 1, 5, 722711) Indeed I venture to suggest that the offer of the States to the British Government lacks the spirit assumed to be behind the aims of the Allies, viz., the saving of democracy for the world.
('76', 380, 1, 6, 722901) The States’ offer to be consistent with the time spirit has to carry with it the will and the co operation of their people.
('76', 380, 1, 7, 723025) This is clearly impossible if the people of the States do not feel that they are partners with the Princes in the administration of the States.
('76', 380, 1, 8, 723169) Viewed in this light, the grant to the people of the greatest measures of responsibility consis tent with their own safety becomes a first and first class war measure so far as the States are concerned.
('76', 380, 1, 9, 723372) And who will say that the people of Travancore, where education has for years been given to the people on a liberal scale, are ready for shouldering the burden of managing their own affairs?
('76', 380, 1, 10, 723563) The responsibility in large States can mean no more than that of a big corporation in the Provinces.
('76', 380, 1, 11, 723664) This suspension of political advance in Travancore on the ground of war comes as a shock and a surprise.
('76', 380, 1, 12, 723769) What connection political reform in the States has with the suspension of Federation is not easy to understand.
('76', 380, 1, 13, 723881) But for the opposition of the Princes, the Muslim League and the Congress, Federation would have come long ago; and I make bold to say that the British Government would gladly bring it in today if the three parties desire it.
('76', 380, 1, 14, 724107) Political reform in the States is overdue and has to come irrespective of Federation.
('76', 380, 1, 15, 724193) I mean no offence to the Princes when I say that generally speaking they may in a sense be compared to Herr Hitler.
('76', 380, 1, 16, 724309) The difference is that they have not his dash, energy, resourcefulness and capacity.
('76', 380, 1, 17, 724394) Every one of the Princes has the powers of absolute autocrats, and they have times without number exercised such powers.
('76', 380, 1, 18, 724515) In their own sphere they enjoy powers which the British monarchs have not possessed for centuries.
('76', 380, 1, 19, 724614) The present British King is merely the first citizen of his country.
('76', 380, 1, 20, 724683) He cannot arrest a single person at his mere wish.
('76', 380, 1, 21, 724734) He cannot administer corporal punishment to a single person without coming like any other citizen under the law of the State.
('76', 380, 1, 22, 724860) This severe limitation on the British monarchy is rightly the envy of the world.
('76', 380, 1, 23, 724941) But every Indian Prince is a Hilter in his own State.
('76', 381, 0, 1, 724995) 382 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('76', 381, 1, 2, 725037) He can shoot his people without coming under any law.

('76', 385, 7, 15, 730600) 491. AN EYE OPENER
('76', 385, 8, 16, 730619) The following note on the development of khadi work in the Ernad taluk up to the end of June 1939 should open the eyes of sceptics as to the possibilities of khadi as a ready made means of giving remunerative employment to the needy millions : 1
('76', 385, 9, 17, 730865) Hand spinning was started by the A.I.S.A. in Ernad taluk as an experimental measure at Pulickal in June 1937. The area has had no tradition for hand spinning.
('76', 385, 9, 18, 731024) Therefore, all those who took to hand spinning had to be taught the art of spinning and carding afresh.
('76', 385, 10, 19, 731128) This successful experiment conducted at Pulickal encouraged the A.I.S.A. to include in the Government grant for khadi for 1938 39 a scheme for starting four more centres in the taluk, viz., Nediyiruppu, Pandikkad, Randhani and Tirurangadi.
('76', 385, 10, 20, 731368) By the end of June 1939 there were 1,233 spinners trained up in the taluk.
('76', 385, 11, 21, 731443) The total expenditure.
('76', 385, 11, 22, 731466) has come to Rs. 5,830 8 10. .
('76', 385, 11, 23, 731496) The cost of implements itself comes to Rs. 3,482 0 6, the whole of which was met out of the Government grant.
('76', 385, 11, 24, 731606) Rs. 488 15 9 was spent out of A.I.S.A. funds in the initial stages at Pulickal and other centres.
('76', 385, 12, 25, 731704) Due to .
('76', 385, 12, 26, 731713) proper training to spinners, the quality of yarn produced is of a very high standard.
('76', 385, 13, 27, 731799) 1 Only extracts from the note by C.K. Karth, Secretary, A.I.S.A., Ernad, are reproduced here.
('76', 386, 0, 1, 731893) VOL. 76 : 31 MAY, 1939 15 OCTOBER, 1939 387
('76', 386, 1, 2, 731937) From February 1939, while we insisted on quality, we also increased the spinning wages by 17.19 per cent of the cost of yarn.
('76', 386, 2, 3, 732063) Efforts are being made to induce the spinners to be habitual wearers of
('76', 386, 3, 4, 732135) To facilitate this work yarn deposits are collected from each spinner.
('76', 386, 4, 5, 732206) at nearly cost price is being issued to spinners in exchange for
('76', 386, 5, 6, 732271) yarn thus deposited.
('76', 386, 6, 7, 732292) A khadi weaving centre is being started at Tirurangadi.
('76', 386, 6, 8, 732348) There is still
('76', 386, 7, 9, 732363) a demand from different places for introduction of hand spinning.
('76', 386, 7, 10, 732429) A separate
('76', 386, 8, 11, 732440) scheme for further development of khadi work in the taluk has been submitted
('76', 386, 9, 12, 732517) as part of the scheme of utilization of the Government grant for 1939 40. Harijan, 7 10 1939

('76', 388, 13, 26, 735305) 497. INDIA’S ATTITUDE
('76', 388, 14, 27, 735327) On the 27th August last, i.e., just before the senseless war broke out, Shrimati Kamaladevi Chattopadhyaya wrote to me as follows :
('76', 388, 15, 28, 735459) 1 Balibehn M. Adalaja, sister of the addressee’s mother in law
('76', 389, 0, 1, 735522) 390 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('76', 389, 1, 2, 735564) I have sent you an appeal through The Bombay Chronicle, asking you to
('76', 389, 2, 3, 735634) voice the attitude of India and of the exploited peoples of the East on the present situation.
('76', 389, 2, 4, 735729) What I meant was not mere reiteration of our old position that we can have nothing to do with this imperialist war, but something more than that.
('76', 389, 2, 5, 735875) The present conflict is mainly centred round the usual scramble for colonies, or spheres of influence as they are now called in polite phraseology.
('76', 389, 2, 6, 736023) On this question the world thinks there are only two opinions, for it hears only two views: one which believes in the maintaining of the satus quo; the
('76', 389, 3, 7, 736175) other which wants a change but on the same basis, in other words, a redistribution of the loot and the right to exploit, which of course means war.
('76', 389, 3, 8, 736323) It is in the very nature of things that such a redistribution can never come about without an armed conflict.
('76', 389, 3, 9, 736433) Whether there will be anyone or anything left to enjoy, of course, is another question.
('76', 389, 3, 10, 736521) But the world is mainly torn between these two.
('76', 389, 3, 11, 736569) If the thesis of the one is accepted, then that of the other should also be.
('76', 389, 3, 12, 736646) For, if England and France have the right to rule over large tracts and big nations, then Germany and Italy have an equal right.
('76', 389, 3, 13, 736775) There is as little moral justification in the former countries crying halt to Hitler as there is in his what he calls his rightful claims.
('76', 389, 4, 14, 736914) That there is a third view the world hardly seems to think, for it rarely
('76', 389, 5, 15, 736988) hears it.
('76', 389, 5, 16, 736998) And it is so essential that it should find expression: the voice of the
('76', 389, 6, 17, 737070) people who are mere pawns in the game.
('76', 389, 6, 18, 737109) Neither Danzig nor the Polish
('76', 389, 7, 19, 737139) corridor is the issue.
('76', 389, 7, 20, 737162) The issue is the principle on which the whole of this
('76', 389, 8, 21, 737216) present Western civilization is based; the right of the strong to rule and
('76', 389, 9, 22, 737291) exploit the weak.
('76', 389, 9, 23, 737309) Therefore it is centered round the whole colonial question,
('76', 389, 10, 24, 737369) and Hitler and Mussolini are never tired of reminding the world of that.
('76', 389, 11, 25, 737442) that is exactly the reason why England has raised the cry of the Empire in
('76', 389, 12, 26, 737517) danger.
('76', 389, 12, 27, 737525) This question therefore vitally concerns all of us.
('76', 389, 13, 28, 737577) We are against the status quo.
('76', 389, 13, 29, 737608) We are fighting against it for we want a
('76', 389, 14, 30, 737649) change in it.
('76', 389, 14, 31, 737663) But our alternative is not war for we know that the real solution does not lie there.
('76', 389, 14, 32, 737749) We have an alternative to offer which is the only solution of this horrible muddle and the key to future world peace.
('76', 389, 14, 33, 737867) It is this which I would like to be placed before the world.
('76', 389, 14, 34, 737928) It may seem today like a cry in the wilderness; still we know that it is the voice which will ultimately prevail; and it is those hands which seem so feeble before these mailed fists that will finally reshape a battered humanity.
('76', 389, 15, 35, 738158) You are eminently fitted to give voice to it.
('76', 389, 15, 36, 738204) India has, I think, a peculiar place today in the colonies of the world.
('76', 389, 15, 37, 738277) It has both a moral prestige and organizational strength enjoyed by few colonies.
('76', 389, 15, 38, 738359) The others look to it for a lead in many matters.
('76', 389, 15, 39, 738409) It has already shown to the world a superior technique
('76', 390, 0, 1, 738464) VOL. 76 : 31 MAY, 1939 15 OCTOBER, 1939 391
('76', 390, 1, 2, 738508) of struggle whose moral value the world is bound to appreciate some day.
('76', 390, 1, 3, 738581) India has therefore to tell a very distraught and maddened world that there is another path humanity must tread if it would save itself from these periodical disasters and bring peace and harmony to a bleeding world.
('76', 390, 1, 4, 738798) It is only those who have suffered so much against this system and who are bravely struggling to change it that can speak with all the conviction and moral basis necessary, speak not only for themselves but all the exploited peoples of the world.
('76', 390, 1, 5, 739045) I am sorry I had not seen Shrimati Kamaladevi’s letter to the Chronicle.
('76', 390, 1, 6, 739118) Try as I will, I simply cannot do adequate justice to the reading of newspapers.
('76', 390, 1, 7, 739199) The letter then remained on my file for want of time to deal with it.
('76', 390, 1, 8, 739269) But I think delay has not affected the object of her letter.
('76', 390, 1, 9, 739330) Perhaps this is the psychological moment for me to express what is or should be India’s attitude.
('76', 390, 1, 10, 739428) I agree with Kamaladevi’s analysis of the motives of the parties to the war.
('76', 390, 1, 11, 739505) Both are fighting for their existence and for the furtherance of their policies.
('76', 390, 1, 12, 739586) There is, however, this great difference between the two; however incomplete or equivocal the declarations of the Allies are, the world has interpreted them to mean that they are fighting for saving democracy.
('76', 390, 1, 13, 739796) Herr Hitler is fighting for the extension of the German boundaries, although he was told that he should allow his claims to be submitted to an impartial tribunal for examination.
('76', 390, 1, 14, 739975) He contemptuously rejected the way of peace or persuasion and chose that of the sword.
('76', 390, 1, 15, 740062) Hence my sympathy for the cause of the Allies.
('76', 390, 1, 16, 740109) But my sympathy must not be interpreted to mean endorsement, in any shape or form, of the doctrine of the sword for the defence even of proved right.
('76', 390, 1, 17, 740259) Proved right should be capable of being vindicated by right means as against the rude, i.e., sanguinary, means.
('76', 390, 1, 18, 740371) Man may and should shed his own blood for establishing what he considers to be his ‘right’.
('76', 390, 1, 19, 740463) He may not shed the blood of his opponent who disputes his ‘right’ India as represented by the Congress has been fighting in order to prove her ‘right’, not by the sword but by the non violent method.
('76', 390, 1, 20, 740664) And she has carved out for herself a unique place and prestige in the world although she is yet far—let us hope, not very far—from the independence of her dream.
('76', 390, 1, 21, 740826) Her novel method has evidently struck the imagination of the world.
('76', 390, 1, 22, 740894) It has the right to expect India to play a decisive part in this war, which no people of the world have wanted, by insisting that the peace this time is not to be a mockery designed to share among the victors the spoils of war and to humiliate the vanquished.
('76', 390, 1, 23, 741154) Jawaharlal Nehru, who has a right to speak for the Congress, has said in stately language that the peace must mean freedom for those who are held in bondage by
('76', 391, 0, 1, 741314) 392 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('76', 391, 1, 2, 741356) the imperialist powers of the world.
('76', 391, 1, 3, 741393) I have every hope that the Congress will also be able to show the world that the power the armaments give to defend right is nothing compared to the power that non violence gives to do the same thing and that too with better show of reason.
('76', 391, 1, 4, 741634) Armaments can show no reason, they can make only a pretence of it.
('76', 391, 1, 5, 741701) SEGAON, OCTOBER 9, 1939 Harijan, 14 10 1939
('76', 391, 2, 6, 741745) 498. TWEEDLEDUM AND TWEEDLEDEE
('76', 391, 3, 7, 741776) In dealing with the situation in Travancore last week 1 I omitted to refer to the controversy between the Dewan and the State Congress as to the source of the information on the basis of which I had wired 2
('76', 391, 4, 8, 741983) to the Dewan hoping that his notice did not ban the conference that was to be held in Travancore by the State Congress.
('76', 391, 4, 9, 742103) Shri Thanu Pillai had said that neither he nor any other member of the State Congress was responsible for suggesting that there was any ban.
('76', 391, 4, 10, 742244) He could not, therefore, say that my telegram to the Dewan was based on such information.
('76', 391, 4, 11, 742334) In saying this he was quite correct.
('76', 391, 4, 12, 742371) As a matter of fact, however, my wire was certainly based upon the information contained in Shri Verghese’s wire 3. But there was no suppression of fact by Shri Verghese.
('76', 391, 4, 13, 742542) Shri Thanu Pillai made his position clear in his letter to the Dewan dated the 23rd ultimo thus :
('76', 391, 5, 14, 742640) In the letter under reference, Government seem to disbelieve my statement that no one from the State Congress informed Gandhiji that there was a ban on the conference.
('76', 391, 5, 15, 742808) Your contention is at best an inference from a telegram from Gandhiji while my assertion is confined to facts within my knowledge.
('76', 391, 5, 16, 742939) The following is the substance of the Government communique as communicated by wire to Gandhiji by the Chairman of the Reception Committee: ‘Government sprung surprise in issuing Press note this noon in view outbreak war state of emergency arisen necessitating measures safeguarding public peace and avoiding incidents likely creating public excitement or large concourses.
('76', 391, 5, 17, 743313) Regarding conference preparations being made for processions and demonstrations and as large crowd may gather at conference, Government in public interest call upon conference organizers and
('76', 391, 6, 18, 743504) 1 Vide “Umfortunate People of Travancore”, 2 10 1939. 2 Vide “Telegram to C. P. Ramaswami Aiyar”, 5 9 1939. 3 Vide “Statement to the Press”, 4 4 1939.

('76', 392, 1, 2, 743699) all political or other organizations in the State to postpone or stop assemblages at present juncture and until further notice.’ Gandhiji might have taken the Government communique calling upon the organizers of the conference and all political or other organizations to postpone or stop such assemblages at the present juncture and until further notice as virtually amounting to prohibiting all meetings and processions.
('76', 392, 1, 3, 744121) If Government still persists in their contention that the State Congress misled Gandhiji, they should in fairness substantiate it.
('76', 392, 1, 4, 744252) The language according to the Travancore legal form may not mean a ban.
('76', 392, 1, 5, 744324) I could give it no other meaning.
('76', 392, 1, 6, 744358) Whether it was technically a ban or not, its effects was that the Congress authorities felt obliged to cancel processions and the other demonstrative part of their programme.
('76', 392, 1, 7, 744533) If, therefore, there is any difference between the language used by the Dewan in the Government communique and a ban, it is the same that exists between Tweedledum and Tweedledee.
('76', 392, 1, 8, 744713) It is also suggested that the communique had to be issued because of objections taken to the holding of the conference.
('76', 392, 1, 9, 744833) Why should a big organization be prevented from functioning properly merely because somebody objects to its so doing?
('76', 392, 1, 10, 744951) I can only appeal to the Dewan not to harass the leaders of the State Congress beyond the point of endurance.
('76', 392, 1, 11, 745061) They should not be made useless even for constructive constitutional activities.
('76', 392, 1, 12, 745142) This is their humble programme :
('76', 392, 2, 13, 745175) This conference resolves that the immediate programme of the State Congress will be :
('76', 392, 3, 14, 745261) 1. Intense, systematic and countrywide propaganda for educating the people on the issue of responsible government.
('76', 392, 3, 15, 745376) 2. The strengthening of the State Congress organization throughout the State and putting the same on self reliant and permanent foundations.
('76', 392, 3, 16, 745517) 3. Real and effective mass contact through a carefully planned programme, emphasizing a mass literacy campaign, khadi and swadeshi and prohibition.
('76', 392, 3, 17, 745665) 4. Establishment of a permanent volunteer and desh sevika service.
('76', 392, 4, 18, 745732) 5. Opening of centres or camps for a minimum period of training for workers in the various programmes outlined above.
('76', 392, 5, 19, 745850) In order to leave no room for doubt, this conference has to point out that the above programme will be wholly constitutional, and that the State Congress has no intention of creating a conflict with Government in the prosecuting of the above programme.
('76', 392, 5, 20, 746103) The object of the above programme is to make the constitutional demand of the people irresistible.
('76', 392, 5, 21, 746202) They do not ask for immediate responsible government.
('76', 392, 5, 22, 746256) Surely they have every right to educate the people along the lines of
('76', 393, 0, 1, 746326) 394 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('76', 393, 1, 2, 746368) responsible government.
('76', 393, 1, 3, 746392) It should be a proud day for the Travancore Maharaja and for his people when it can be said of the latter that by patient and quiet training they made themselves fit to shoulder the responsibility of managing the affairs of their State.
('76', 393, 1, 4, 746629) SEGAON, October 9, 1939 Harijan, 14 10 1939
('76', 393, 2, 5, 746673) 499. A MINISTER’S DREAM
('76', 393, 3, 6, 746697) If you can give a message or direction to the Provincial Governments and the people to see that spinning and weaving are made compulsory for boys and girls in all the schools, I have no doubt that within a short time the children of schools will be wearing cloth made by themselves.
('76', 393, 3, 7, 746980) This will be the first step.
('76', 393, 3, 8, 747009) I have not lost faith in your ideals and I am hoping to see that each home will make its own cloth and each village will become self sufficient not only with regard to cloth but also every other article of necessity under your village industries scheme and education scheme.
('76', 393, 3, 9, 747284) I believe with you that real swaraj in this land can be established only when the budget of the villager is balanced alongside of the budget of the Provincial Government or that of the Government of India which is brought about by artificial adjustments and manipulations generally.
('76', 393, 3, 10, 747567) Thus writes a Congress Minister.
('76', 393, 3, 11, 747600) If I had the powers of an autocrat, I would certainly make hand spinning compulsory in at least the primary schools.
('76', 393, 3, 12, 747717) A Minister who has the faith should do so.
('76', 393, 3, 13, 747760) There are several useless things made compulsory in our schools.
('76', 393, 3, 14, 747825) Why should not this most useful art be made compulsory?
('76', 393, 3, 15, 747881) But nothing can be made compulsory in a democratic system, if it is not widely popular.
('76', 393, 3, 16, 747969) Thus compulsion in democracy is only so called.
('76', 393, 3, 17, 748017) It removes laziness, it does not force will.
('76', 393, 3, 18, 748062) Such compulsion is an educative process.
('76', 393, 3, 19, 748103) I suggest a milder preliminary course.
('76', 393, 3, 20, 748142) Let there be prizes given to the best spinner.
('76', 393, 3, 21, 748189) This competition will induce many if not all to take part in it.
('76', 393, 3, 22, 748254) No plan will succeed if the schoolmasters themselves have no faith in it.
('76', 393, 3, 23, 748328) If basic education is accepted by the Provincial Governments, hand spinning and the like is not merely part of the curriculum, it is the vehicle of education.
('76', 393, 3, 24, 748487) If basic education takes root, khadi surely becomes universal and comparatively cheap in this afflicted land of ours.
